title: Service Stream dials up interest in Lendlease's Services
text:
ASX-listed small cap Service Stream is one of the final parties in the running for construction giant Lendlease's Services business.

Street Talk understands the telecommunications services provider is in second-stage due diligence on the unit, having lodged an indicative and non-binding bid a few months ago, and is working through the diligence materials with a view to making a formal offer.

Service Stream is best known for its operations and maintenance contract with NBN Co. James Alcock

It would be a big move for Service Stream, whose share price has swelled over the past five years to take its market value above $1 billion.

It's perhaps best known for its operations and maintenance contract with NBN Co, which generated the company $275 million revenue in the 2019 financial year but will not last forever.

The company provides services for fixed line and wireless telecommunications networks, as well as water, gas and electricity network owners and operators. It also counts Optus as a customer, after inking a 5G wireless design and construction agreement with the telco in September this year.
description: Service Stream is one of the final parties in the running for construction giant Lendlease's Services business.
